Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2011 03:49PM Jaydra wrote: Only way to be sure the lump isn't something serious is to get the appropriate tests. Even Mammograms and ultrasounds don't give a definitive answer.. best way to be sure is to have it biopsied. I've read that *most* (not all) cancer lumps are painless and 80% of lumps are benign so the numbers are on your side.. but better safe than sorry!!
Posts.Title: Please help, did your lump hurt? Betterwannabe mtks

Posts.Content: Jul 16, 2010 10:23AM - edited Jul 16, 2010 10:24AM by Jaydra from everything I've read, grey discharge is usually indicative of duct ecstasia. If youre not happy with your diagnosis, keep pushing..there are other tests you can have, skin punch biopsy to test for Paget's.. a ductogram.. maybe even ask for a referral to a breast specialist? Good Luck and I hope everything is B9!

Posts.Content: Aug 9, 2010 09:55AM Jaydra wrote: you wanted advice, so here's mine. Go back to the doctor and tell your doctor about these new symptoms. It could very well be because your body might be fighting off an illness and might not be related but at the very least, you could push for an ultrasound of that lump to be sure it's a cyst as your doctor thinks it is! I hope it all goes well for you!! Good Luck!

Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2010 05:12PM Jaydra wrote: From what I have read (and another member confirmed this to me on the phone) a white discharge especially one that isn't spontaneous (only comes out when squeezed) isn't anything to worry about. However, for peace of mind perhaps you may wish to bring it up with your doctor :)
Posts.Title: nipple discharge jlb60 redsox

Posts.Content: Jaydra wrote: A few days after my surgery for a duct excision.. I started experiencing some swelling.. it's hard and tender near the incisions.. is this normal? I've done some reading online.. I can only mostly find pages regarding breast augmentation and comments regarding that say that it's called edema and normally occurrs around 5 days after surgery (that's about when it started for me as well) and can last 2 weeks to 6 months. Can anyone verify this?  I see my surgeon next week (where I also find out results from the excisional biopsy.. man am I petrified!!) just wanted to make sure this is normal or if I should call him on Tuesday. I haven't had any fevers or anything. Thanks! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: duct excision/ breast surgery Jaydra MrsNice

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2011 07:09PM Jaydra wrote: I have fibrocystic breasts and one is definitely worse than the other. In August, I had surgery on my right breast as my nipple was inverted.. the result was fibrocystic changes and duct ectasia Now the area I had the surgery is still hard and often tender (and was very painful the last couple days) so I'm back at it again.. had an ultrasound today. I read somewhere that it's not unusual for one to be worse than the other.. however, the other one tends to "catch up" eventually  I also just read about a connection between Hypothyroidism and fibrocystic breasts so you may want to get a blood test to check for that. I am hypothyroid (hashimoto's thyroiditis) so I guess there is some truth in it? lol Good Luck!
Posts.Title: Question about Fibrocystic Change CUGymGirl Jaydra

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2010 11:54PM Jaydra wrote: I have some of your symptoms. I can get discharge if I squeeze my nipple (however it's usually greenish and only contained blood last Thursday) I have a lump by my nipple as well, however it's not hard.. more like a tenderness and I also have some nipple retraction going on (however it's not always retracted and when it is.. I can evert it) and my nipples look noticeably different I've had a mammogram and an ultrasound that came back ok and 2 biopsy's the first came back fibrocystic changes and the 2nd came back as atypical/indeterminate possible papillary Surgeon feels that it's a papilloma and I will have the ducts excised in 2 weeks. can you feel enlargement behind your nipple at all? (like a rope-like feeling) I would suggest what imadaughter had suggested and see if you can get seen for free somewhere or even assistance of some kind. What's going on with you could be something benign and simple, it could be an infection or a papilloma (which although usually benign should be removed) or it could be something serious. It's hard to say. I certainly hope it's benign and that all will be well. But, fact is you can't ever be really sure without the diagnostic tests and even more so... a biopsy.

Posts.Title: waiting on duct excision heyjude62 lago

Posts.Content: Jaydra wrote: I had an excisional biopsy in August.. some duct tissue was removed so the scar runs along my areaola on my right breast. After the surgery I had a lot of hardness.. I talked to the nurses on the phone from the surgeon's office who insisted the hardness was normal.. in December it was still fairly hard and sometimes painful so I saw the surgeon who said he wasn't concerned and it did indeed feel like scar tissue as it was also in the area where I had the surgery. The area of hardness was fairly big back in August/September but now it's maybe the size of a golf ball maybe even smaller than that. The last couple days it has been very painful.. I have an ultrasound booked for this morning.. I'm just wondering what's "normal".. you don't see a lot of talk online about what happens *after* surgery. Has anyone else had pain at their surgery location? does the hardness ever go away?  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Is scar tissue painful? Jaydra NaskarStar3

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2011 08:25PM Jaydra wrote: Well, thank you for letting me know that.. that's now 2 people that have experienced painful scar tissue.. gives me a little relief, however I've never been one to catch my chickens before they hatch and I'm sure I will drive myself nuts with anxiety once again make sure you get that test.. there's a great site called stop the thyroid madness that has a long list of hypothyroid symptoms.. check it out sometime, I was surprised to see how many there are and how many I have lol http://www.stopthethyroidmadness.com/long-and-pathetic/ I sent you a private message as well ;)

Posts.Title: maybe someone can help me out here mykidsmomma Jaydra

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2011 08:43AM Jaydra wrote: Thanks for sharing your experiences as well.. I have done a lot of reading on this and have even found some older posts on the boards.. seems this is more common then I realized and I wonder why surgeons don't tell patients what to expect in regards to scar tissue etc so that we're not freaking out later. My surgery was in August (fibrocystic and duct ectasia).. it was hard and painful for awhile.. some of the hardness went away and the pain shrunk to a mild discomfort especially during my period... so it shocked me to have pain again.. pain that was bringing me to tears! According to the ultrasound it is scar tissue and there is a small build up of fluid around it which may be the beginning of an infection.. so I'm on some antibiotics now and guess we'll go from there.. a day and a half into the antibiotics, the pain is subsiding.  I'm wondering if because it was duct ectasia (which is just another form of periductal mastitis apparently) if I will have these issues forever. I did quit smoking 17 days ago.. so hopefully that helps!
